projects.name: Skeleton-based Interaction Recognition
projects.summary: This project aimed to recognize and understand interactions involving multiple entitiesâ€”such as human bodies, hands, objects, or other elements within a scene. Our goal was to unify the recognition tasks of person-peron, hand-hand, hand-object interactions, and even group activities.
highlights: Led and played a key role in every aspect of the project, including method design, coding, conducting experiments, result analysis and manuscript writing.
Proposed a model based on entity rearrangement and token attention, achieving SOTA performance across 4 benchmarks.
Enabled the single-entity backbones (e.g., CTR-GCN) to achieve SOTA performance on 6 multi-entity action benchmarks in subsequent research.
Published this work in the IROS 2023 conference proceedings, with subsequent research currently under review for NeurIPS 2024.

projects.name: Progressive Reasoning with World Models for Robotic Manipulation
projects.summary: This project built a robot manipulation simulator based on UE5, which can automatically generate robot manipulation demonstration data containing complex language instructions. With this simulator, we created a robot manipulation benchmark with progressive inference tasks, and proposed a world model-based robot manipulation method.
highlights: Reviewed recent works related to robotic manipulation and deployed 3+ multimodal models (e.g., BC-Z, RT-1) using PyTorch.
Trained multimodal models using reinforcement learning in the simulation environment to enable accurate comprehension of human language instructions and object grasping.

projects.name: Action Recognition by Integrating Human Parsing Modality and Body Pose
projects.summary: This project was the first to explore leveraging complementary information from human parsing and body pose to achieve superior recognition performance.
highlights: Developed and refined the multimodal fusion framework, enhancing the integration of human parsing and pose data.
Assisted in conducting experiments and contributed to manuscript writing.
Published this work in the CICAI 2024 conference proceedings, with subsequent research published in CAAI Transactions on Intelligence Technology.

projects.name: Facial Prior Guided Micro-Expression Generation
projects.summary: This project aimed to generate realistic micro-expression video clips. We incorporated action units, a facial prior in psychology, into the first-order motion model to achieve realistic generated micro-expressions.
highlights: Participated in the development of the proposed models, including data preprocessing, method design, and implementation.
Designed and ran experiments across 3 datasets, conducting ablation studies.
Achieved first place with a score of 316 in the ACMMM 2021 FME Challenge.
Participated in the subsequent research on learnable facial prior combinations, objective evaluation metrics, etc.
Published the challenge solution in the ACMMM 2021 conference proceedings, with subsequent research published in IEEE Transactions on Image Processing.

projects.name: Semi-Supervised Learning-Based Computer-Aided Diagnosis for COVID-19
projects.summary: This project focused on lesion segmentation in COVID-19 CT images using semi-supervised learning, proposing CARes-UNet and semi-CARes-UNet to achieve SOTA performance on 3 benchmarks.
highlights: Builded the semi-supervised learning framework to leverage large-scale unlabeled CT data with pseudo-labeling.
Led the Writing and revision of the manuscript during the whole review process.
Published this work in Medical Physics.
